view

Class ParticleEmitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.ParticleEmitter

  • public class ParticleEmitter
extends java.lang.Object
    Object that creates and tracks particles for smoke/fog/spark effects in the game. Needs to be queued for rendering every frame to get displayed. Should call update() method every frame to animate the particles.
    Author:
    Tadas

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParticleEmitter

        public ParticleEmitter(java.lang.String imageName,
               int maxAge,
               long spawnTimer,
               int maxParticles,
               int x,
               int y,
               int startVelocityX,
               int startVelocityY,
               int startAccelerationX,
               int startAccelerationY,
               int variation)
        Initializes a new particle emitter.
        Parameters:
        imageName - Name of the image that will be used by every particle.
        maxAge - Maximum age of a particle
        spawnTimer - How much time should pass between creation of new particles
        maxParticles - Maximum number of particles
        x - initial particle position
        y - initial particle position
        startVelocityX - initial particle velocity
        startVelocityY - initial particle velocity
        startAccelerationX - initial particle acceleration
        startAccelerationY - initial particle acceleration
        variation - Used to introduce randomness/variation in particle movement speeds.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(long deltaTime)
        Updates the particles using basic newtonian physics. Kills the dead particles.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - time that has passed between the frames.

      • applyParticleModifications

        public void applyParticleModifications(Particle p)
        Makes the particle more transparent based on its age. Could be overloaded to achieve variety of effects.
        Parameters:
        p - particle that's to be modified

      • killParticle

        void killParticle(int index)
        Moves a dead particle to the end of the alive particles list. Used internally.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the particle that needs to be killed.

      • addParticle

        void addParticle()
        Spawns a new particle. Used internally

      • getRenderable

        public Renderable getRenderable()
        Renderable that gets used by every single particle. Most of the values stored in this object are ignored by the renderer, therefore it should only be used internally
        Returns:
        renderable used by all the particles.

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enable emitter so that it would render/update its particles every frame.

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Prevent system from rendering/updating every frame.

      • getActive

        public boolean getActive()
        Is the system being updated/renderer every frame.
        Returns:
        If true then the emitter is active

      • getParticles

        public Particle[] getParticles()
        Returns the array that has info about all the particles. Ideally only used by the renderer.
        Returns:
        All the particles (possibly dead particles too) stored by the system.

      • getAlive

        public int getAlive()
        Returns the number of active particles
        Returns:
        number of particle that have not reached the max age yet.

      • getVariedXSpawn

        public int getVariedXSpawn()
        Returns the horizontal particle spawning variation
        Returns:
        Horizontal particle spawning variation

      • setVariedXSpawn

        public void setVariedXSpawn(int variedXSpawn)
        Sets the horizontal particle spawning variation
        Parameters:
        variedXSpawn - Horizontal particle spawning variation
